thread.title: Steve Blake tabbed Pistons' backup point guard over Spencer Dinwiddie
thread.title_full: Steve Blake tabbed Pistons' backup point guard over Spencer Dinwiddie

author: freep.com
title: Steve Blake tabbed Pistons' backup point guard over Spencer Dinwiddie
text:
MORE Detroit Pistons coach Stan Van Gundy didn't need to see much of Steve Blake.
After a concussion limited the veteran only to Friday night's exhibition finale, Van Gundy said Blake is the likely backup point guard when the Pistons open the regular season at Atlanta on Tuesday night.
Blake will be the first choice when starter Reggie Jackson needs a break — despite second-year point Spencer Dinwiddie putting up solid performances during the latter part of the exhibition season.
"He's just got a lot of experience," Van Gundy said of Blake on Sunday. "I like the way he moves the ball, passes the ball.
"I thought Spencer, though, has played four pretty good games in a row, so I'd be comfortable having him out there and we'll see how it goes, but yeah I think Steve will be our backup."
Blake, 35, was acquired in the off-season from the Brooklyn Nets. He was added as insurance because Brandon Jennings is rehabbing a ruptured Achilles and likely won't be available until December.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Pistons exercise Bullock's $2.3M option for 2016-17
But he suffered a nasty spill on the second day of training camp and it took nearly three weeks for Blake to pass the league's mandated concussion protocols.
He recovered in time for Friday's game and he excelled — dishing out a game-high 12 assists in 24 minutes in the Pistons' 115-87 victory over the Hawks.
■ Granger update: The deadline to set rosters is this afternoon, and that's when the Pistons will likely part ways with small forward Danny Granger, who was part of the deal that also brought Marcus Morris and Reggie Bullock from Phoenix this summer.
He is still in Arizona rehabbing a bum knee, but Van Gundy expects him to surface later this year with another team.
When the Pistons waive Granger, they will eat the $2.2 million he is owed this season. The only other outcome is a late-developing trade, but that seems doubtful.
